item.title: More rubbish here!, 26th October
item.description:
Rubbish is being dumped here virtually every other day. Council rubbish truck operatives see it but won’t touch it until after it’s reported, which encourages other fly-tippers to add to the pile. Why isn’t there an instruction for to have this spot constantly monitored and cleared on sight?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61a, Dartmouth Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New graffiti on front of building, 26th October
item.description:
There has been graffiti on the side of this building for some time. Now, graffiti is also being placed on the front of the building, on the light poles around the building, and even in the park retaining walls in front of the property. Can this ongoing vandalism please be addressed as soon as possible. Thanks so much. :)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Revolting sight!, 26th October
item.description:
These bins are out of control again. Anyone with rubbish seems to use them

item.title: Litter bin door is broken and off the hinges, 26th October
item.description:
The Litter bin door in between Campbell Court and Bew Court by the path on the left hand side is broken and is broken and off the hinges. Please can we reattach to the bin or replace the bin chamber.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf clean please, 26th October
item.description:
Hi, I hope you are well. Could we please get a leaf clean on Holmdene Avenue? I can see we aren’t on the autumn schedule for another few weeks but there is very heavy leaf fall which is already turning to mulch around the cars. If we could get one sooner that would be great please!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Holmdene Avenue, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Top of street, 26th October
item.description:
New tree planted but tripping hazard of bricks and stones surrounding tree.. I have reported this before and it came back ‘no further action’. There needs to be further action please……someone was supposed to phone me back too…nobody did!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Hadley Street, Kentish Town, London

item.title: Black bags of rubbish thrown over fence and bridge, 26th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Avery Hill, London

item.title: Sycamore trees, 26th October
item.description:
I keep my horses at Perry street farm and my field backs onto the car park on Ashurst Close. There are a number of sycamore trees growing in that car park along the chain link fence line however they are highly poisonous to horses if they eat the trees, leaves and the ‘helicopters’ that fall from them. They can cause death within hours. Due to this I have had to shut my horses out of the fields. Please could these be cut down. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashurst Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
